result.execSummary:
The defendant Javier U Barrientos Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Cases 15CM361 the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year

miscConds.notes: --maintain current employment unless otherwise approved by Agent

--not to consume alcohol or controlled substance or any other drug unless prescribed and has valid prescription; take prescriptions only as prescribed 

--not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment  by Agent

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--provide a DNA sample 

--  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: Jefferson PD

records.addlTxt: AMENDED - cc: DA & DOC (electronically), Atty Luchsinger  /tn 12-15-16
cc: DA & DOC (electronically), Atty Luchsinger  /tn 12-15-16
with Elements attached
Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 15CM361 and 16CT339 called together at 9:14am [ma]
Defendant Javier U Barrientos Martinez in court with attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski--sworn as Spanish Interpreter

The Court grants the State leave to file the amended complaint; removing the DA enhancer from 15CM361
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " GUILTY " entered to Cases 15CM361, without DA enhancer and 16CT339; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--ADA Hall submits victim impacts statement or restitution form; verifies victim rights compliance  

The Court determines that Mr. Barrientos Martinez has the ability to pay restitution and that there is a nexus between the damage and the actions in case 16CT339

On Cases 15CM361 and 16CT339: the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment by Agent
--not to consume alcohol or controlled substance or any other drug unless prescribed and has valid prescription; take prescriptions only as prescribed 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--maintain current employment unless otherwise approved by Agent 
--to pay statutory costs 
--to pay restitution in the amount of $885.94 to Curtis Hill (as to Case 16CT339)
--not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license 
--provide a DNA sample 

Days credit for time already served:  1  day as to 15CM361 and 1 day as to 16CT339

recess:9:50am
Attorney Steven Luchsinger
Bond Payment Information
Status conference on December 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 2, 2016 at 10:20 am.

Amended. covering cases 16CT339 & 15CM361
to Cover Cases 16CT339 and 15CM361

Case 15CM361  called at 1:33pm. 
Defendant Javier U Barrientos Martinez appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Shawna Stevenoski present as Spanish Interpreter
Defendant is eligible for SPD representation 

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court and Counsel discuss 16CT339
The Court maintains the cash bail in 16CT339, it now covers both cases 16CT339 and 15CM361, with any conditions previously ordered in either case.
The Court removes the return on warrant date for 16CT339

recess 1:43  pm. 


NEXT: As to Both Cases: (1) Pretrial Conference on 11/2/16 at 10:20am  (2) Status Conference on 12/13/16 at 9:00am

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] Cases #15CM361 and #15CM363 called at 11:29am. 
Co- Defendant Javier U Barrientos Martinez in court.
Co-Defendant Manuel A. Revolirio Martinez in court.
ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter for Manuel Revolirio Martinez.
Both Defendants verify that the dates of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given. The Court refers the Co-Defendants to the PD Office; they should go there today to apply for representation. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered and speedy trial waived by the Court on behalf of both Co-Defendants.
The Court continues the $150 Cash Bonds already posted by each Co-Defendant.  
recess 11:39am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/28/15 at 11:00 (for #15CM361) and 3:00pm (for #15M363),   (2) Status Conference on 12/8/15 at 10:30am.
